learning_outcomes.description: Engage critically and constructively with the professional, legal and ethical responsibilities and requirements of working in private practice.SPA PS Domains/Standards 1.1, 1.2, 1.3; SPA Code of Ethics

Generate creative and practical solutions to promote private practice engagement for speech pathology stakeholders.Speech Pathology Australia Professional Standards (2020) (SPA PS) Domains/Standards 1.3, 2.2, 2.5, 2.7, 3.6

Advocate for and work in professional and interprofessional teams to support private practice as a health professional to support continued practice within the NDIS and the community more broadly.SPA PS Domains/Standards 1.1 – 1.7, 2.1, 2.2, 2.3, 2.5, 2.6, 3.1 – 3.6
Describe the value of supervision, mentoring and networking in a private practice SPA PS Domains/Standards 1.3, 2.2; SPA Code of Ethics.
Explain business and marketing obligations for contemporary private practice.SPA PS Domains/Standards 1.1, 1.2, 1.3, 2.1, 2.2, 2.3, 2.5; SPA Code of Ethics

Understand the influences on, and mechanisms by which, speech pathologists can support and advocate effective and ethical management of NDIS clients within private practice.SPA PS Domains/Standards 1.1, 1.2, 1.4, 1.6, 1.7, 2.2, 2.5, 2.6, 3.1

Describe qualities of leadership in speech pathology and critically reflect on personal leadership strengths and opportunities to develop the skills required to become an effective leader.SPA PS Domains/Standards 2.1, 2.2, 2.3, 2.5
Reflect on the skills and knowledge required to optimise personal and professional wellbeing within private practice.SPA PS Domains/Standards 1.2, 1.3, 2.1, 2.2, 2.3

assessments.due_date:
20/03/2026 1:00 pm

A detailed task description and marking criteria will be made available on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.task_description:
Each student is required to complete an assignment discussing the management of personal and professional wellbeing as a speech pathologist within private practice. With reference to the supplied case information and based on Speech Pathology Australia's Code of Ethics and Professional Standards, students will discuss the speech pathologist's risks for burnout, how to manage wellness, and reflect on their own practice and wellness management in relation to the case.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct
assessments.submission_guidelines: The assessment task is to be submitted via the course e-learning Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
1/04/2026 2:00 pm

The exam will be held during class time
assessments.task_description:
Using the Speech Pathology Australia code of ethics, professional standards and other relevant SPA policies and guidelines, students will be asked discuss content from private practice scenarios and apply content learnt in this course.

This examination will be an in-person on-campus School based In-semester examination via Inspera. Students will have access to the Speech Pathology Australia Code of Ethics and Professional Standards during the examination. 

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

A detailed task description and marking criteria will be made available on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.category: Paper/ Report/ Annotation, Presentation, Product/ Design
assessments.task_description:
Working in groups with a private practice partner, students will develop a resource that has been determined by the private practice. This resource will be co-designed with the private practice partner to support professional conduct, life-long learning, and the practice of new graduate speech pathologists in this sector. The resource will be showcased in a recorded presentation. Students will also develop a business plan advocating for the resource they are developing. This business plan will advocate for the purpose and efficacy of the resource within the private practice. Students will also complete a peer assessment on teamwork.

This assessment has three (3) different components:

Component 1: Business Plan

  • Due Date: 17/04/2026 1:00 pm
  • Weight: 15%
  • Description: Students will provide a business plan for their private practice resource
  • Submission: Component 1 will be submitted via the course eLearning Blackboard site. An SHRS coversheet signed by the student must accompany the submission.


Component 2: Private Practice Resource and Presentation

  • Due Date: 16/06/2026 1:00 pm
  • Weight: 30%
  • Description: Students will provide a copy of their private practice resource and a recorded presentation discussing the resource.
  • Submission: Component 2 will be submitted via the course eLearning Blackboard site. An SHRS coversheet signed by the student must accompany the submission.


Component 3: Peer Evaluation (Buddycheck)

  • Due Date: 16/06/2026 5:00 pm
  • Weight: 5%
  • Description: Students will complete a peer assessment on teamwork
  • Submission: Component 3 will be submitted via the course eLearning Blackboard site.


Further details will be made available on the SPCH4111 Blackboard site.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Students will be required to submit their resource, audio-visual recording (presentation), business plan and Buddycheck via the course eLearning Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
The School of Health and Rehabilitation has produced private practice modules for student learning. As part of this course (SPCH4111), students will complete module 2 to complement their learning about speech pathology and the private sector. To successfully complete this module, students must complete a small quiz at the end of this module. The quiz does not count towards your overall grade for SPCH4111.

Multiple attempts of the quiz are allowed until the passing mark of 80% is achieved.

This quiz will be open from 23/2/2026 to 06/03/2026.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Students will be required to access and complete the module and quiz via the eLearning Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 7(23 Feb - 19 Apr)
learning_activities.topic:
Online self-directed learning modules (self-directed learning)

A series of weekly online modules will provide information about working as a speech pathologist in the private sector. The self-directed learning module content will cover a broad range of topics, including:

  • Working in the private sector as a speech pathologist
  • Marketing and business skills needed to work in private practice
  • Professional and personal wellbeing in private practice
  • Supervision, mentoring and networking in private practice
  • Key stakeholders in private practice
  • Speech pathologists as leaders, clinicians and entrepreneurs
learning_activities.topic_description: Online self-directed learning modules (self-directed learning) A series of weekly online modules will provide information about working as a speech pathologist in the private sector. The self-directed learning module content will cover a broad range of topics, including: Working in the private sector as a speech pathologist Marketing and business skills needed to work in private practice Professional and personal wellbeing in private practice Supervision, mentoring and networking in private practice Key stakeholders in private practice Speech pathologists as leaders, clinicians and entrepreneurs

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 7(23 Feb - 19 Apr)
learning_activities.topic:
Weekly on campus tutorials

Tutorials will be conducted from weeks 1-7 of semester and will incorporate applied learning independently, in small group and large group discussions to further explore private practice and speech pathology. Tutorials have been designed for experiential learning and therefore, students are expected to attend and actively participate in all tutorials. It is essential that students prepare for tutorials by completing the online self-paced learning resources and associated preparation activities. As students will be working in groups during this learning activity, tutorials will not be recorded.
